summary: This document is an email chain between U.S. Attorney's Office personnel discussing the preparation of a sharing order application to share additional trust and will documents received from Jeffrey Epstein's estate attorneys. The correspondence focuses on ensuring the materials are accurately described before submission.

events.title: Email discussion on Epstein sharing order
events.description: U.S. Attorney's Office personnel exchange emails about updating and reviewing a sharing order application to share additional trust and will documents received from Epstein's estate attorneys.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office received additional trust and will documents from Jeffrey Epstein's estate attorneys in late January 2020.
Prosecutors were preparing a sharing order application to legally share these newly received materials with other parties.
The email chain shows internal coordination to ensure the legal documents accurately describe the materials received.
The correspondence indicates ongoing post-mortem legal proceedings regarding Epstein's estate documents.
